citation.article-title: Mycoplasma glycophilum, a new species of avian origin.

p.s: Description of Mycoplasma glycophilum sp. nov.
Mycoplasma glycophilum (Gly-co-phi'lum Gr. adj. glykys sweet, glucose; Gr. adj. philos loving; M.L. neut. adj. glycophilum glucose-loving)
Thin sections show mainly spherical and elliptical particles with a triple-layered membrane and no cell wall.
Average diameter of cells is 628 nm.
Passes through a 450 nm porediameter filter but is retained by 220 nm pores.
No reversion to cell wall forms in the absence of peniciilin and thallium acetate.
Glucose utilized, but not arginine or urea.
Weak or no phosphatase activity and weak tetrazolium reduction under anaerobic incubation only.
No production of film and spots, serum digestion, or hydrolysis of aesculin or arbutin.
Adsorption of turkey but not chicken red blood cells.
Serologically distinct from described Mycoplasma species.
The guanine plus cytosine content of the DNA is 27.5 mol%.
